title: kalihunter
author: kalihunter
content: Hello Community,I have 1500$ and i want to invest it crypto as holdings. What do us suggest invest it all on BTC or alts? Thanks

comments.author: Faisal2202
comments.body: Quote from: kalihunter on November 08, 2023, 04:51:25 PMHello Community,I have 1500$ and i want to invest it crypto as holdings. What do us suggest invest it all on BTC or alts? ThanksNever follow others always do your own research because this $1500 is yours, but if I have to assume that this money is mine and I have been given the opportunity to make holdings from it then I will definitely go into alts because alts can give me some good profit but you (reader) might be wondering why I did not choose BTC because these $1500 are given to me to make money by holdings. And even if I will lose this money in Alts I will not regret it as the money is not mine.But If I would care about money, then I would go for BTC, and at the current market, I would not go all on BTC because the market is showing like it is bullish which it is but I don't know why the feelings in my mind tell me that it will come down to $30k at least. So, for that, I will keep some funds aside to buy at dip, some funds for emergency, and the remaining one will be invested in BTC.

comments.author: adaseb
comments.body: Whatever you decide to invest in, you need to make sure your crypto doesn't get stolen.You got 3 options1) Use an exchange. You can use an exchange which is the easiest however you need to make sure you use a unique email, password, and don't use 2FA with SMS. This is pretty basic and unless the exchange goes bankrupt your crypto is safe.2) Use a hardware wallet. These cost like $100 or so and you use it to sign transactions.3) Cold storage. This is free, just need an old computer that is never connected to the internet which you will use just to sign the transaction.

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Quote from: kalihunter on November 08, 2023, 04:51:25 PMHello Community,I have 1500$ and i want to invest it crypto as holdings. What do us suggest invest it all on BTC or alts? ThanksInvest it into Bitcoin because it's the safest option for you. I won't recommend you the altcoins because they aren't as reliable as Bitcoin and any of them can go zero in value. If still you want to go with altcoins then I recommend you to do your research and choose among the old and well-known altcoins like Monero, Dogecoin, LTC and a few others which have been doing good for many years.Never ever invest your money into newly launched tokens because they are very risky and you can lose everything. I have personally invested in some of the newly launched coins and lost a lot of money and that's why I recommend you to be careful from those newly launched coins. The old altcoins are still okay as investment but I still prefer Bitcoin investment.

comments.body: Quote from: kalihunter on November 08, 2023, 04:51:25 PMHello Community,I have 1500$ and I want to invest it in crypto as holdings. What do we suggest to invest it all in BTC or alts? ThanksSince you made a public thread to seek advice on where to invest your 1500k,  you have to know that if you looking for to invest that money in cryptocurrency then you have to understand the risk involved and how you must avoid it,  at some point,  if you believe that you want to invest that amount in crypto then you can invest by holding less volatile assets. But much more also you have to consider Bitcoin but on a long-term basis so you have to be ready to wait for a while to see your investment grow with significant profits since your amount in the capital is such a small amount at this point which will translate into longer waiting time let say the 1-year cycle of time frame for your investment to mature.

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: I think Bitcoin's probably your best bet if you want something stable in crypto.  It's the OG coin! But if you've got an appetite for risk, maybe spread out a bit into some altcoins that seem promising after you've done your homework on them and  just remember it's so key to research what you're buying into - really understand the projects and think hard about your goals long-term.  Crypto's a rollercoaster so buckle up for the peaks and valleys.Wishing you luck with investing!

comments.body: Quote from: kalihunter on November 08, 2023, 04:51:25 PMHello Community,I have 1500$ and i want to invest it crypto as holdings. What do us suggest invest it all on BTC or alts? ThanksAre you a beginner, the best advice is to invest all of it in Bitcoin and see how the market will wave Bitcoin and you'll have the idea how everything moves just as it all depends on it. If you heard out newbies made a lot of money with altcoins, they're just as lucky as they start out. The trend has been in their favor and they have never expected that to happen. Usually, people who have made a lot of money from altcoins, it's either they've known that project for so long or they all suddenly invested in it just because the trend was seen on those. For you as a beginner and don't have any idea yet, it's always best to go along which is the market mover and that's Bitcoin.Maybe someday in the future, you'll explore with altcoins when you have already seen how the market moves and how more volatile the altcoins are and understands that they're all following Bitcoin.

comments.author: ZAINmalik75
comments.body: Quote from: kalihunter on November 08, 2023, 04:51:25 PMHello Community,I have 1500$ and i want to invest it crypto as holdings. What do us suggest invest it all on BTC or alts? ThanksI would say to invest that money in BTC if you are planning on holding it, because it is the best in terms of risk and volatility. If you are planning to hold for 2 or more years, then I hope you can make 2x or 3x on your investment. There is no doubt that if you invest this same money in alts with proper calculations, you might make 2x or 3x in one day, but that will depend on the trading you are wanting to do.At the current market price, I can say there are many decent alts in the market that can make more than 2x or 3x on your holdings if you hold them for 2 or more years, but the difference between both is risk. You and I don't get to know when those assets we have invested in will go under the earth, and we don't know whether they can make us twice as much after 2 years or if they can make us twice as much before that period, and that would be our only chance to book profit. Which means we have to be active in the market while dealing with alts.Holding in BTC becomes less risky, and based on your newbie account, I would suggest you hold your funds by buying BTC and do not buy all at once; instead, buy in parts. Recent news of an ETF is coming, and if that spreads up, we might see BTC reach $40,000 in the next week.
